perturbation.original_text: Buyer Affiliates shall pay ExxonMobil's Selling Affiliates invoice(s) not later than the days set forth in Attachment E hereto. All invoices shall be paid in full by wire transfer in accordance with the invoice's instructions.
perturbation.changed_text: Buyer Affiliates shall pay ExxonMobil's Selling Affiliates invoice(s) not later than the days set forth in Attachment E hereto. However, Buyer may defer payment up to an additional 30 days, incurring a late payment fee of 1% per month on the outstanding balance. All invoices shall be paid in full by wire transfer in accordance with the invoice's instructions.
perturbation.explanation: This creates an in-text contradiction by allowing the buyer to defer payment with a late fee, directly conflicting with the initial requirement to pay within the timeframe outlined in Attachment E. This introduces uncertainty about the actual payment deadline and associated penalties.

ATTACHMENT E

Notwithstanding the above, for all transactions, Buyer Affiliates may elect to pay within 90 days, subject to a 3% financing fee.
perturbation.explanation: This creates an in-text contradiction by adding a general payment term override to the specific payment terms outlined for each location. This adds to the previous created perturbation by creating ambiguity whether the location specific terms or the general override applies and increases the legal uncertainty. This also adds a second conflicting payment terms.

perturbation.original_text: 1. PRICE AND QUANTITY; PRICE ADJUSTMENTS Except as otherwise provided in this Agreement, and without regard to any course of dealing between the parties: (1) Seller shall not be obligated to sell or deliver any quantity of product(s) covered hereby ("Product") beyond the amount, if any, which in Seller's sole judgment, is available for such purpose as of the proposed date of shipment to Buyer; (2) the price of Product shall be Seller's price therefor as of the date of shipment; (3) Seller reserves the right to set minimums and/or premiums or to reject orders for unusual configurations, sizes and folds; (4) an overrun or underrun of up to ten percent (10%) shall constitute due performance of any order; (5) any freight allowances shall be those specified by Seller as of the date of shipment; and (6) Buyer shall allow Seller a reasonable period for delivery of shipments of Product. Seller may change any price, freight or payment term hereof upon no less than thirty (30) days' prior written notice; provided, however, that Seller may at any time institute or remove a temporary voluntary allowance of other similar competitive allowance without prior notice.
perturbation.changed_text: 1. PRICE AND QUANTITY; PRICE ADJUSTMENTS Except as otherwise provided in this Agreement, and without regard to any course of dealing between the parties: (1) Seller shall not be obligated to sell or deliver any quantity of product(s) covered hereby ("Product") beyond the amount, if any, which in Seller's sole judgment, is available for such purpose as of the proposed date of shipment to Buyer; (2) the price of Product shall be Seller's price therefor as of the date of shipment, unless a fixed price has been agreed upon; (3) Seller reserves the right to set minimums and/or premiums or to reject orders for unusual configurations, sizes and folds; (4) an overrun or underrun of up to ten percent (10%) shall constitute due performance of any order; (5) any freight allowances shall be those specified by Seller as of the date of shipment; and (6) Buyer shall allow Seller a reasonable period for delivery of shipments of Product. Seller may change any price, freight or payment term hereof upon no less than thirty (30) days' prior written notice; provided, however, that Seller may at any time institute or remove a temporary voluntary allowance of other similar competitive allowance without prior notice. Any fixed prices agreed to will be honored regardless of market fluctuations.
perturbation.explanation: This introduces a direct contradiction regarding pricing. The original clause states the price is 'Seller's price...as of the date of shipment.' The added text introduces the concept of a 'fixed price' without clarifying the conditions for establishing such a price, leading to ambiguity. This contradiction creates uncertainty regarding the price determination mechanism, potentially leading to disputes. This adds a third conflicting price terms.
